CLI Integration Tests for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! These tests spawn the actual `bz` binary and verify:\n//! - Exit codes for various commands\n//! - stdout/stderr output\n//! - Correct behavior in isolated temp directories\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst fs = std.fs;\nconst process = std.process;\nconst testing = std.testing;\n\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\n/// Result from running the bz CLI.\nconst RunResult = struct {\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    stdout: []const u8,\n    stderr: []const u8,\n    term: process.Child.Term,\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *RunResult) void {\n        self.allocator.free(self.stdout);\n        self.allocator.free(self.stderr);\n    }\n\n    pub fn exitCode(self: RunResult) ?u32 {\n        return switch (self.term) {\n            .Exited => |code| code,\n            else => null,\n        };\n    }\n\n    pub fn succeeded(self: RunResult) bool {\n        return self.exitCode() == 0;\n    }\n};\n\n/// Run bz from the project root using absolute paths.\nfn runBzFromRoot(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, args: []const []const u8, work_dir: []const u8) !RunResult {\n    // Build the absolute path to bz binary\n    const cwd_path = try fs.cwd().realpathAlloc(allocator, \".\");\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_path);\n\n    const bz_path = try fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ cwd_path, \"zig-out/bin/bz\" });\n    defer allocator.free(bz_path);\n\n    var argv: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer argv.deinit(allocator);\n\n    try argv.append(allocator, bz_path);\n    for (args) |arg| {\n        try argv.append(allocator, arg);\n    }\n\n    var child = process.Child.init(argv.items, allocator);\n\n    // Set the working directory (need to dupe the path since argv items are freed)\n    const cwd_dup = try allocator.dupe(u8, work_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_dup);\n    child.cwd = cwd_dup;\n\n    child.stdout_behavior = .Pipe;\n    child.stderr_behavior = .Pipe;\n\n    try child.spawn();\n\n    // Read stdout and stderr using readToEndAlloc\n    const stdout_bytes = if (child.stdout) |stdout_file|\n        stdout_file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 1024 * 1024) catch &[_]u8{}\n    else\n        &[_]u8{};\n    errdefer allocator.free(stdout_bytes);\n\n    const stderr_bytes = if (child.stderr) |stderr_file|\n        stderr_file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 1024 * 1024) catch &[_]u8{}\n    else\n        &[_]u8{};\n    errdefer allocator.free(stderr_bytes);\n\n    const term = try child.wait();\n\n    return .{\n        .allocator = allocator,\n        .stdout = stdout_bytes,\n        .stderr = stderr_bytes,\n        .term = term,\n    };\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"bz version shows version info\" {\n    const allocator = testing.allocator;\n\n    const cwd_path = try fs.cwd().realpathAlloc(allocator, \".\");\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_path);\n\n    var result = try runBzFromRoot(allocator, &[_][]const u8{\"version\"}, cwd_path);\n    defer result.deinit();\n\n    try testing.expect(result.succeeded());\n    try testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, result.stdout, \"bz\") != null);\n}\n\ntest \"bz help shows usage\" {\n    const allocator = 29→    pub fn jsonStringify(self: Self, jws: anytype) !void {\n    30→        const epoch_seconds = std.time.epoch.EpochSeconds{ .secs = @intCast(self.value) };\n    31→        const day_seconds = epoch_seconds.getDaySeconds();\n    32→        const epoch_day = epoch_seconds.getEpochDay();\n    33→        const year_day = epoch_day.calculateYearDay();\n    34→        const month_day = year_day.calculateMonthDay();\n    35→\n    36→        var buf: [25]u8 = undefined;\n    37→        const formatted = std.fmt.bufPrint(&buf, \"{d:0>4}-{d:0>2}-{d:0>2}T{d:0>2}:{d:0>2}:{d:0>2}Z\", .{\n 42→            day_seconds.getMinutesIntoHour(),\n    43→            day_seconds.getSecondsIntoMinute(),\n    44→        }) catch unreachable;\n    45→\n    46→        try jws.write(formatted);\n    47→    }\n    48→\n    49→    pub fn jsonParse(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, source: anytype, options: std.json.ParseOptions) !Self {\n    50→        const token = try source.nextAllocMax(allocator, ts;\n    }\n\n    // Try YYYY-MM-DD format\n    if (date_str.len == 10 and date_str[4] == '-' and date_str[7] == '-') {\n        const year = std.fmt.parseInt(i32, date_str[0..4], 10) catch return null;\n        const month = std.fmt.parseInt(u4, date_str[5..7], 10) catch return null;\n        const day = std.fmt.parseInt(u5, date_str[8..10], 10) catch return null;\n\n        if (month < 1 or month > 12) return null;\n        if (day < 1 or day > 31) return null;\n\n        // Convert to days since epoch\n        const epoch_day = epochDayFromYMD(year, month, day) catch return null;\n\n        // Convert to seconds (midnight UTC)\n        return @as(i64, epoch_day) * 86400;\n    }\n\n    return null;\n}\n\n/// Calculate epoch day from year/month/day.\nfn epochDayFromYMD(year: i32, month: u4, day: u5) !i32 {\n    // Algorithm from Howard Hinnant's date algorithms\n    const y: i32 = if (month <= 2) year - 1 else year;\n    const era: i32 = @divTrunc(if (y >= 0) y else y - 399, 400);\n    const yoe: u32 = @intCast(y - era * 400);\n    const m: u32 = month;\n    const doy: u32 = (153 * (if (m > 2) m - 3 else m + 9) + 2) / 5 + day - 1;\n    const doe: u32 = yoe * 365 + yoe / 4 - yoe / 100 + doy;\n    return era * 146097 + @as(i32, @intCast(doe)) - 719468;\n}\n\n/// Get the default actor name from environment.\n/// On Windows, returns null (env var access requires allocation).\n/// Use --actor flag to specify the actor on Windows.\nfn getDefaultActor() ?[]const u8 {\n    const builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) return null;\n    return std.posix.getenv(\"USER\") orelse std.posix.getenv(\"USERNAME\");\n}\n\n/// Read the ID prefix from config.yaml, defaulting to \"bd\".\nfn getConfigPrefix(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, beads_dir: []const u8) ![]u8 {\n    const config_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"config.yaml\" });\n    defer allocator.free(config_path);\n\n    const file = std.fs.cwd().openFile(config_path, .{}) catch {\n        return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n    };\n    defer file.close();\n\n    const content = file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 4096) catch {\n        return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n    };\n    defer allocator.free(content);\n\n    // Simple YAML parsing for prefix: \"value\"\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"prefix:\")) |prefix_pos| {\n        const after_prefix = content[prefix_pos + 7 ..];\n        // Find the value (skip whitespace, handle quotes)\n        var i: usize = 0;\n        while (i < after_prefix.len and (after_prefix[i] == ' ' or after_prefix[i] == '\\t')) {\n            i += 1;\n        }\n\n        if (i < after_prefix.len) {\n            if (after_prefix[i] == '\"') {\n                // Quoted value\n                i += 1;\n                const start = i;\n                while (i < after_prefix.len and after_prefix[i] != '\"' and after_prefix[i] != '\\n') {\n                    i += 1;\n                }\n                if (i > start) {\n                    return try allocator.dupe(u8, after_prefix[start..i]);\n                }\n            } else {\n                // Unquoted value\n                const start = i;\n                while (i < after_prefix.len and after_prefix[i] != '\\n' and after_prefix[i] != ' ' and after_prefix[i] != '\\t') {\n                    i += 1;\n                }\n                if (i > start) {\n                    return try allocator.dupe(u8, after_prefix[start..i]);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"parseDateString parses YYYY-MM-DD\" {\n    const result = parseDateString(\"2024-01-29\");\n    try std.testing.expect(result != null);\n    // 2024-01-29 00:00:00 UTC should be around 1706486400\n    const ts = result.?;\n    try std.testing.expect(ts > 1706400000 and ts < 1706600000);\n}\n\ntest \"parseDateString parses RFC3339\" {\n    const result = parseDateString(\"2024-01-29T14:53:20Z\");\n    try std.testing.expect(result != null);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(i64, 1706540000), result.?);\n}\n\ntest \"parseDateString returns null for invalid format\" {\n    try std.testing.expect(parseDateString(\"invalid\") == null);\n    try std.testing.expect(parseDateString(\"01-29-2024\") == null);\n    try std.testing.expect(parseDateString(\"2024/01/29\") == null);\n}\n\ntest \"getConfigPrefix returns default when file missing\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, \"/nonexistent/path\");\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"bd\", prefix);\n}\n\ntest \"CreateError enum exists\" {\n    // Just verify the error set compiles\n    const err: CreateError = CreateError.EmptyTitle;\n    try std.testing.expect(err == CreateError.EmptyTitle);\n}\n\ntest \"CreateResult struct works\" {\n    const result = CreateResult{\n        .success = true,\n        .id = \"bd-abc123\",\n        .title = \"Test issue\",\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(result.success);\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"bd-abc123\", result.id.?);\n}\n\ntest \"run validates empty title\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const tmp_dir_path = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"create_empty\");\n    defer allocator.free(tmp_dir_path);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(tmp_dir_path);\n\n    const data_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ tmp_dir_path, \".beads\" });\n    defer allocator.free(data_path);\n\n    try std.fs.cwd().makeDir(data_path);\n\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ data_path, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    const f = try std.fs.cwd().createFile(issues_path, .{});\n    f.close();\n\n    const create_args = args.CreateArgs{ .title = \"\" };\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = data_path };\n\n    const result = run(create_args, global, allocator);\n    try std.testing.expectError(CreateError.EmptyTitle, result);\n}\n\ntest \"run validates title length\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const tmp_dir_path = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"create_long\");\n    defer allocator.free(tmp_dir_path);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(tmp_dir_path);\n\n    const data_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ tmp_dir_path, \".beads\" });\n    defer allocator.free(data_path);\n\n    try std.fs.cwd().makeDir(data_path);\n\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ data_path, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    const f = try std.fs.cwd().createFile(issues_path, .{});\n    f.close();\n\n    const long_title = \"x\" ** 501;\n    const create_args = args.CreateArgs{ .title = long_title };\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = data_path };\n\n    const result = run(create_args, global, allocator);\n    try std.testing.expectError(CreateError.TitleTooLong, result);\n}\n\ntest \"run creates issue successfully\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    const tmp_dir_path = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"create_success\");\n    defer allocator.free(tmp_dir_path);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(tmp_dir_path);\n\n    const data_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ tmp_dir_path, \".beads\" });\n    defer allocator.free(data_path);\n\n    try Supports both predefined\n//! types and custom user-defined types.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\n\n/// Issue type/category classification.\npub const IssueType = union(enum) {\n    task,\n    bug,\n    feature,\n    epic,\n    chore,\n    docs,\n    question,\n    custom: []const u8,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Convert IssueType to its string representation.\n    pub fn toString(self: Self) []const u8 {\n        return switch (self) {\n            .task => \"task\",\n            .bug => \"bug\",\n            .feature => \"feature\",\n            .epic => \"epic\",\n            .chore => \"chore\",\n            .docs => \"docs\",\n            .question => \"question\",\n            .custom => |s| s,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Parse a string into an IssueType (case-insensitive for known values).\n    /// Returns .custom for unknown values.\n    pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) Self {\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"task\")) return .task;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"bug\")) return .bug;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"feature\")) return .feature;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"epic\")) return .epic;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"chore\")) return .chore;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"docs\")) return .docs;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"question\")) return .question;\n        return .{ .custom = s };\n    }\n\n    /// JSON serialization for std.json.\n    pub fn jsonStringify(self: Self, jws: anytype) !void {\n        try jws.write(self.toString());\n    }\n\n    /// JSON deserialization for std.json.\n    pub fn jsonParse(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, source: anytype, options: std.json.ParseOptions) !Self {\n        const token = try source.nextAllocMax(allocator, .alloc_if_needed, options.max_value_len.?);\n        const str = switch (token) {\n            .string, .allocated_string => |s| s,\n            else => return error.UnexpectedToken,\n        };\n        return fromString(str);\n    }\n\n    /// JSON deserialization from already-parsed value.\n    pub fn jsonParseFromValue(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, source: std.json.Value, options: std.json.ParseOptions) !Self {\n        _ = allocator;\n        _ = options;\n        return switch (source) {\n            .string => |s| fromString(s),\n            else => error.UnexpectedToken,\n        };\n    }\n};\n\ntest \"toString returns correct strings for known types\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"task\", (IssueType{ .task = {} }).toString());\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"bug\", (IssueType{ .bug = {} }).toString());\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"feature\", (IssueType{ .feature = {} }).toString());\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"epic\", (IssueType{ .epic = {} }).toString());\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"chore\", (IssueType{ .chore = {} }).toString());\n    try \"fromString parses known types correctly\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.task, IssueType.fromString(\"task\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.bug, IssueType.fromString(\"bug\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.feature, IssueType.fromString(\"feature\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.epic,    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.question, IssueType.fromString(\"question\"));\n}\n\ntest \"fromString is case-insensitive\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.task, IssueType.fromString(\"TASK\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.task, IssueType.fromString(\"Task\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.task, IssueType.fromString(\"tAsK\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.bug, IssueType.fromString(\"BUG\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.bug, IssueType.fromString(\"Bug\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.feature, IssueType.fromString(\"FEATURE\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.feature, IssueType.fromString(\"Feature\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.epic, IssueType.fromString(\"EPIC\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.chore, IssueType.fromString(\"CHORE\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.docs, IssueType.fromString(\"DOCS\"));\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(IssueType.question, IssueType.fromString(\"QUESTION\"));\n}\n\ntest \"fromString returns custom for unknown values\" {\n    const result = IssueType.fromString(\"unknown_type\");\n    switch (result) {\n        .custom => |s| try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"unknown_type\", s),\n        else => return error.TestExpectedCustom,\n    }\n}\n\ntest \"toString/fromString roundtrip for known types\" {\n    const types = [_]IssueType{\n        .task,\n        .bug,\n        .feature,\n        .epic,\n        .chore,\n        .docs,\n        .question,\n    };\n\n    for (types) |issue_type| {\n        const str = issue_type.toString();\n        const parsed = runList(list, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn runCreate(\n    create_args: anytype,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = Epic management commands for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz epic create <title>` - Create a new epic (issue with type=epic)\n//! `bz epic add <epic_id> <issue_id>` - Add an issue to an epic\n//! `bz epic remove <epic_id> <issue_id>` - Remove an issue from an epic\n//! `bz epic list <epic_id>` - List issues in an epic\n//!\n//! Epics are high-level issues that contain other issues. The relationship\n//! is modeled using the parent_child dependency type.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst id_gen = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst Dependency = models.Dependency;\nconst DependencyType = models.DependencyType;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst DependencyGraph = common.DependencyGraph;\nconst DependencyGraphError = storage.DependencyGraphError;\n\npub const EpicError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    EpicNotFound,\n    IssueNotFound,\n    NotAnEpic,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n    EmptyTitle,\n    TitleTooLong,\n    InvalidPriority,\n};\n\npub const EpicResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    id: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    epic_id: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issue_id: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    action: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issues: ?[]const IssueInfo = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\nconst IssueInfo = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    title: []const u8,\n    status: []const u8,\n    priority: u8,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    epic_args: args.EpicArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (epic_args.subcommand) {\n        .create => |create| try runCreate(create, global, allocator),\n        .add => |add| try runAdd(add, global, allocator),\n        .remove => |remove| try runRemove(remove, global, allocator),\n        .list => |list| try runList(list, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn runCreate(\n    create_args: anytype,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    if (create_args.title.len == 0) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"title cannot be empty\");\n        return EpicError.EmptyTitle;\n    }\n    if (create_args.title.len > 500) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"title exceeds 500 character limit\");\n        return EpicError.TitleTooLong;\n    }\n\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return EpicError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return EpicError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    var store = storage.IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return EpicError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    const priority = if (create_args.priority) |p|\n        Priority.fromString(p) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(EpicResult, &output, structured_output, \"invalid priority value\");\n            return EpicError.InvalidPriority;\n        }\n    else\n        Priority.MEDIUM;\n\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    var generator = id_gen.IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    const issue_count = store.countTotal();\n    const issue_id = try CLI argument parsing for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! Parses command-line arguments into structured data for command dispatch.\n//! Supports global flags, subcommands, and subcommand-specific arguments.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\n\n/// Global CLI options that apply to all commands.\npub const GlobalOptions = struct {\n    json: bool = false,\n    toon: bool = false,\n    quiet: bool = false,\n    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    verbose: u8 = 0,\n    no_color: bool = false,\n    data_path: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    actor: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    lock_timeout: u32 = 5000,\n    no_auto_flush: bool = false,\n    no_auto_import: bool = false,\n\n    /// Returns true if structured output (JSON or TOON) is enabled.\n    pub fn isStructuredOutput(self: GlobalOptions) bool {\n        return self.json or self.toon;\n    }\n};\n\n/// All available subcommands.\npub const Command = union(enum) {\n    // Workspace\n    init: InitArgs,\n    info: void,\n    stats: void,\n    doctor: void,\n    config: ConfigArgs,\n\n    // Issue CRUD\n    create: CreateArgs,\n    q: QuickArgs,\n    show: ShowArgs,\n    update: UpdateArgs,\n    close: CloseArgs,\n    reopen: ReopenArgs,\n    delete: DeleteArgs,\n\n    // Batch Operations\n    add_batch: AddBatchArgs,\n    import_cmd: ImportArgs,\n\n    // Query\n    list: ListArgs,\n    ready: ReadyArgs,\n    blocked: BlockedArgs,\n    search: SearchArgs,\n    stale: StaleArgs,\n    count: CountArgs,\n    defer_cmd: DeferArgs,\n    undefer: UndeferArgs,\n\n    // Dependencies\n    dep: DepArgs,\n    graph: GraphArgs,\n\n    // Epics\n    epic: EpicArgs,\n\n    // Labels\n    label: LabelArgs,\n\n    // Comments\n    comments: CommentsArgs,\n\n    // Audit\n    history: HistoryArgs,\n    audit: AuditArgs,\n\n    // Sync\n    sync: SyncArgs,\n\n    // System\n    version: void,\n    schema: void,\n    completions: CompletionsArgs,\n\n    // Help\n    help: HelpArgs,\n};\n\n/// Init command arguments.\npub const InitArgs = struct {\n    prefix: []const u8 = \"bd\",\n};\n\n/// Create command arguments.\npub const CreateArgs = struct {\n    title: []const u8,\n    description: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issue_type: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    priority: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    assignee: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    labels: []const []const u8 = &[_][]const u8{},\n    deps: []const []const u8 = &[_][]const u8{},\n    due: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    estimate: ?i32 = null,\n};\n\n/// Quick capture command arguments.\npub const QuickArgs = struct {\n    title: []const u8,\n    priority: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Show command arguments.\npub const ShowArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    with_comments: bool = true,\n    with_history: bool = false,\n};\n\n/// Update command arguments.\npub const UpdateArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    title: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    description: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issue_type: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    priority: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    assignee: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    status: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Close command arguments.\npub const CloseArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Reopen command arguments.\npub const ReopenArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n};\n\n/// Delete command arguments.\npub const DeleteArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n};\n\n/// Add-batch command arguments.\n/// Creates multiple issues from stdin or a file with single lock acquisition.\npub const AddBatchArgs = struct {\n    file: ?[]const u8 = null, // Read from file instead of stdin\n    format: BatchFormat = .titles, // Input format\n};\n\n/// Batch input format.\npub const BatchFormat = enum {\n    titles, // One title per line\n    jsonl, // Full JSONL format (one issue per line)\n\n    pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?BatchFormat {\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"titles\")) return .titles;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"jsonl\")) return .jsonl;\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"json\")) return .jsonl;\n        return null;\n    }\n};\n\n/// Import command arguments.\n/// Imports issues from a JSONL file with single lock acquisition.\npub const ImportArgs = struct {\n    file: []const u8, // Path to JSONL file (required)\n    merge: bool = false, // Merge instead of replace\n    dry_run: bool = false, // Show what would be imported without importing\n};\n\n/// List command arguments.\npub const ListArgs = struct {\n    status: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    priority: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issue_type: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    assignee: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    label: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    limit: ?u32 = null,\n    all: bool = false,\n};\n\n/// Ready command arguments.\npub const ReadyArgs = struct {\n    limit: ?u32 = null,\n};\n\n/// Blocked command arguments.\npub const BlockedArgs = struct {\n    limit: ?u32 = null,\n};\n\n/// Search command arguments.\npub const SearchArgs = struct {\n    query: []const u8,\n    limit: ?u32 = null,\n};\n\n/// Stale command arguments.\npub const StaleArgs = struct {\n    days: u32 = 30,\n    limit: ?u32 = null,\n};\n\n/// Count command arguments.\npub const CountArgs = struct {\n    group_by: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Defer command arguments.\npub const DeferArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    until: ?[]const u8 = null, // RFC3339 date or relative like \"+7d\"\n    reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Undefer command arguments.\npub const UndeferArgs = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n};\n\n/// Epic subcommand variants.\npub const EpicSubcommand = union(enum) {\n    create: struct {\n        title: []const u8,\n        description: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        priority: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    },\n    add: struct {\n        epic_id: []const u8,\n        issue_id: []const u8,\n    },\n    remove: struct {\n        epic_id: []const u8,\n        issue_id: []const u8,\n    },\n    list: struct {\n        epic_id: []const u8,\n    },\n};\n\n/// Epic command arguments.\npub const EpicArgs = struct {\n    subcommand: EpicSubcommand,\n};\n\n/// Dependency subcommand variants.\npub const DepSubcommand = union(enum) {\n    add: struct {\n        child: []const u8,\n        parent: []const u8,\n        dep_type: []const u8 = \"blocks\",\n    },\n    remove: struct {\n        child: []const u8,\n        parent: []const u8,\n    },\n    list: struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n    },\n    tree: struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n    },\n    cycles: void,\n};\n\n/// Dependency command arguments.\npub const DepArgs = struct {\n    subcommand: DepSubcommand,\n};\n\n/// Graph command output formats.\npub const GraphFormat = enum {\n    ascii,\n    dot,\n\n    pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?GraphFormat {\n        if (std.ascii.eqlIgnoreCase(s, \"ascii\")) return .ascii;\n        if
